website_summaries.verdict: Emerica Reynolds G6s are Andrew’s signature shoes that are just as badass as the 1998 SOTY winner himself. These kicks are definitely built for extreme skating because of their ultra-durable build that can withstand hours of daily abuse with nary a tear in sight.The cushioning and impact protection in these is also quite high, and with the cupsole construction, bruises on arches and heels are a thing of the past. The soles are the perfect combination of board feel and rigidity, and with these on, you’ll never hurt your feet on gaps again.
pros: A lot of Emerica Reynolds G6 shoe reviews mentioned nothing but praises for the kicks’ durability especially when it comes to the three-piece toe layers
Many commended the sneakers’ high impact protection, which makes jumping down stairs and other high places painless
Several skateboarders who wear-tested Emerica Reynolds G6 shoes claimed the support in these is amazing
These are the perfect skate shoes, according to a good number of users who say these give a nice solid edge for grip and flick
These sneakers from Emerica’s skate lineup provide enough cushioning where you need it and are extremely comfy, plenty stated
The shoes’ board feel is excellent and is not sacrificed for padding or comfort
A few noted that the fit is exemplary
cons: Some users who skated Emerica Reynolds G6 shoes reported that the laces rip easily

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love The Boss
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with Reynolds shoes. I've owned countless pairs of Emericas and would recommend them to anyone. The only thing with the G6 is the toe is a bit too snug. That might just be because of my wide toes. Other than that, super comfortable as expected from Emerica and Reynolds.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: Yo get em.
customer_reviews.text: I've had emerica since 7th grade and I've never found a brand that's as true fit and quality to match. Reynolds 3 I have 4 pairs and had Reynold 2s and this is them 2.1. Best shoes I own and practical unlike wearing my d3s around these are worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Best Reynold Model Yet.
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid fan of the Reynolds Emerica model shoe. This version is the best yet! The G6 sole makes them supper comfy for when your on your feet for a long time. I have back issues and these shoes provide superior support. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Turf

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are not for razor scooters
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe for F#@$ing off, going out drinking, and skating. Nice work on this one
customer_reviews.author: Phily B.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, they are awesome and I am thinking about getting other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Beraha

customer_reviews.title: Kinda stiff to break in but worth it once you do-awesome skate shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Kinda narrow and stiff to break in, but really nice for skateboarding. The heel support is good if you have narrow heels like me, especially downhill cruising/bowls. I haven’t had them for long but so far, so good. My Vans Half Cabs are my favorite but these are definitely second.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great skate shoe and more
customer_reviews.text: These are how skate shoes should be. They are super comfortable and form fitted. In addition, they’re great for other uses i.e. gym use/squats/deadlifts. I can’t recommend Reynolds’ shoes enough.
customer_reviews.author: BoltYourDoor

customer_reviews.title: Still cool and even more functional
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of the first Reynolds back in the day and I liked them then and I’ll like these now. The tongue on this shoe is worth the admission. Great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Eazy Eric

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Good, comfortable shoe to walk around in. Not great for skating... board feel is next to none. Unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wide for larger feet but are not supportive and the insoles are very thin.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Missing the old timey (2003-7) shoes? This is the one.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic grip. Great cushioning compared to all the thinned out shoes. Durable and comfy! Not broken in completely but board feel is great.
customer_reviews.author: Joong Won Kim

product_meta.title: Emerica Men's Reynolds G6 Skate Shoe
product_meta.description: Inspired by the iconic pro models of andrew's past. The new reynolds G6 is a true cupsole with a pour-in G6 poly-urethane midsole. The toecap features a double-double sided layer of hot melt that bonds the panels together. All made up to andrew's standards. 100 percent backed by the boss.
feature_bullets: Pour in G6 polyurethane mid sole
